creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Marilyn Tupper Doe
description: bands of thin vertical blue lines cut across scene of wall with large temple gate; tops of trees and roofs visible behind wall; two leafless trees in background; lone figure under umbrella near stone bridge LLC
dimension:
10 9/16 × 9 5/8 in. (26.83 × 24.45 cm) (sight)
36 7/8 × 34 3/4 × 1 1/4 in. (93.66 × 88.27 × 3.18 cm) (outer frame, framed with others: see notes)
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Twelve Months of Kyoto 京名勝十二月
title: June (Rainy scene of the "Sen-ke," Japanese tea ceremony founder's house)
